title: Meet Latin & First Grammar!
goals: Introduce Latin as the language of faith and learning
Teach basic Ecclesiastical pronunciation through alphabet chant
Learn five starter vocabulary words: salve, vale, pax, Deus, rosa
Understand that nouns are naming words (things and persons)
Connect faith phrase Pax vobiscum with virtue Fides – Faith

steps.speak: Salve! I am Sparky, your Latin friend. Latin is an ancient language used by the early Church and still sung in our prayers. Today we begin with joy!

Listen to the Latin alphabet. Some letters sound different from English: C before E or I sounds like 'ch', and G before E or I sounds like 'j'. U sounds like W. Repeat each after me as we chant the alphabet together!
Let’s sing the alphabet chant: A-B-C-D-E-F-G… Latin sings faithfully! Excellent!
Now learn your first Latin words: salve means hello, vale means goodbye, pax means peace, Deus means God, and rosa means rose. Repeat after me!
Can you point to something God made that is beautiful? That name is a noun. In Latin we call a naming word 'nomen'. Nouns name things—like Deus or rosa.
Let’s chant together: salve, vale, pax, Deus, rosa! Wave hello, wave goodbye, hands together for peace, point up for God, and pretend to smell a rose.
Faith phrase of the week: Pax vobiscum – Peace be with you. Say it softly, then loudly, then with your hands open in blessing.
Mini-derivative time: pax gives us 'pacify' and 'peaceful'; Deus gives us 'divine'; rosa gives us 'rosary'. Latin is hiding in many English words!
Beautiful work! Faith means trusting that each small step matters. Tomorrow we’ll learn how Latin shows what a noun does. Vale—goodbye!
